fields.headline: Hockney fired up
fields.bodyText: The last minister to come north bearing gifts was Michael Heseltine. He planted a few trees in our city, but cut off all the investment and reduced the city to pauper status (Four authorities to test 'big society', 19 July). Yesterday David Cameron came north and told us to do what we want, only he wasn't going to pay for any of it ... probably because it's all been given to the banks. Steven Calrow Liverpool • May I congratulate the coalition for its fantastic success in bringing down unemployment and crime so quickly (Crime at lowest level for three decades, 16 July), while having to deal with a record deficit caused solely by the previous administration. Well done, chaps. Ian Parsons Bradford • I agree hand skills should be restored to the curriculum (Letters, 19 July). But this would require a fundamental change of attitude in the education system, where "good with his hands" is frequently headteacher's code for "thick". Rob Brown Chester • Thanks to Johnny Homer (Letters, 19 July) and all campaigners against smoking David Hockney is now confined to his studio doing what he loves best – creating masterpieces and having a fag. So stop and enjoy the pictures. Michael Minas Teddington, Middlesex • Have others seen the likeness of BP chief executive Tony Hayward (Report, 19 July) to Michael Sheen and foresee Michael's next role in BP: The Disaster? Don Turgoose Manchester • I enjoyed BBC TV's coverage of the Open Golf and was intrigued to learn that Peter Alliss's Ooshoozen, Wayne Grady's Esthoozen, Sam Torrance's Westerhazen, and Hazel Irvine's Whoosterhoos all won this year's trophy. Andrew Norman Poole, Dorset • I can tell Rufus cumes from oop north (Cryptic crossword, 19 July). "Crux" doesn't rhyme with "crooks" down the East End, where I come from. Gerry Abbott Manchester
